items.title: Inaccurate translation from Bengali to English(Reporting a bug)
items.body:
In Bengali, 1 = ১ , 2 = ২, 7 = ৭ , 8 = ৮, 
when I translate them independently it translates correctly, 
But when I try to translate ১৭,১৮,২৭,২৮, it translates to 16,16,26,26, 
I tried to make it right by specifying the service_urls, but it did not work. 
I am new to python, so still not familiar enough to work with source code.

items.title: Timeout after hundreds of translations
items.body:
<!-- Before submitting an issue, please consult our docs (https://py-googletrans.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) -->

<!-- Please make sure you are posting an issue pertaining to Googletrans. -->

<!-- Please try not to submit support requests of personal needs. We want to keep the library in a simple way. -->

<!-- ISSUES MISSING IMPORTANT INFORMATION MAY BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATION. -->

**Googletrans version:**

- [x] **3.x**

**I'm submitting a ...** 
<!--  (check one with "x") -->

- [x] bug report
- [ ] feature request

<!-- Please try not to submit support requests of personal needs. We want to keep the library in a simple way. -->

**Current behavior:**
<!-- Describe how the bug manifests. -->

I am using Googletrans in China. I set the translator as `Translator(service_urls=['translate.google.cn'])` and It works. But when I try to translate thousands of individual sentences, exception `httpcore._exceptions.ConnectTimeout: timed out` always happen. If I translate one sentence each time, exception will happen after about 300 translations; if I try a batch of sentences (Advances Usage), exception happens and translation will never finish. I have tried to sleep for every 50 or 200 translations but it never worked. I want to know if there is a solution for this problem, otherwise I have to translate 300 sentences each time and It is time consuming.

**Expected behavior:**
<!-- Describe what the behavior would be without the bug. -->

**Steps to reproduce:**
<!--  Please explain the steps required to duplicate the issue, especially if you are able to provide a sample application. -->

**Related code:**

<!-- If you are able to illustrate the bug or feature request with an example, please provide a sample application via one of the following means:

-->

        print(str(count) + '   ', translation.origin, ' -> ', translation.text)
        query = translation.text
        result.append({'query': query, 'id': id})

items.title: Disabling autocorrection
items.body:
I think autocorrection is an issue here,
for example for word 'misguide' :
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20641837/85193530-ddb1ee00-b2e2-11ea-8c82-709b745ed6b5.png)
after force clicking on 'misguide' link it gives right repsonse:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20641837/85193550-0b973280-b2e3-11ea-8dde-7106e3be5057.png)
In **py-googletrans** it looks like this:
```bash
translate misguide --dest pt
[en] misguide
    ->
[pt] missguided
[pron.] misguide
```
To disable autocorrection, you should turn it off in utils.build_params:
https://github.com/ssut/py-googletrans/blob/e10c5e8fa73b32700b0b6eab163e01664b6d5ff1/googletrans/utils.py#L12
change to:
```python
'dt': ['at', 'bd', 'ex', 'ld', 'md', 'qc', 'rw', 'rm', 'ss', 't'],
```
Thus autocorrections won't bother anymore:
```bash
translate misguide --dest pt
[en] misguide
    ->
[pt] desencaminhar
[pron.] None
```

items.title: Pulling the "Translations of..." data as a way of correcting source language input
items.body:

items.title: Problem with proxy
items.body:
When I create a Translator with a proxies, I fount it will not work properly.
```
proxies = {'http':'http://username:password@xxx:8080', 'https':'http://username:password@xxx:8080'}
translator = Translator(service_urls=['translate.google.com']， proxies = proxies)
```
I have debugged the code and found some problems:
1. at client.py
```
    def _translate(self, text, dest, src, override):
        token = self.token_acquirer.do(text)
        params = utils.build_params(query=text, src=src, dest=dest,
                                    token=token, override=override)

        url = urls.TRANSLATE.format(host=self._pick_service_url())
        r = self.session.get(url, params=params) # Here will call request, but not passing the proxies parameters to request, need change to
       r = self.session.get(url, params=params, proxies = self.session.proxies, verify = self.session.verify) 
```
2. at gtoken.py
```
    def _update(self):
        """update tkk
        """
        # we don't need to update the base TKK value when it is still valid
        now = math.floor(int(time.time() * 1000) / 3600000.0)
        if self.tkk and int(self.tkk.split('.')[0]) == now:
            return

        r = self.session.get(self.host) # Here alsocall request, but not passing the proxies parameters to request, need change to
        r = self.session.get(self.host, params=params, proxies = self.session.proxies, verify = self.session.verify)
```
3. at client.py
```
    def __init__(self, service_urls=None, user_agent=DEFAULT_USER_AGENT,
                 proxies=None, timeout=None): # Here suggest to add verfiy parameter

        self.session = requests.Session()
        if proxies is not None:
            self.session.proxies = proxies
        # if we have verify parameter, we may set it to self.session.verify
```

>       Because it may generate SSL error when use proxies with username & password.
>       Sometime it may resolved by install request's security package ：
>       `pip install -U request[security]`
>       But it may also generate some errors sometime, so we can set the verify to False

items.body:
def upload_file():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        f = request.files['file']
        path='static/data/'+f.filename
        f.save(path)

        j_file = open('final-project-test.json', errors='ignore')
        loaded_json_model = j_file.read()
        j_file.close()

        model = model_from_json(loaded_json_model)
        model.load_weights('final-project-test.h5')
        img1 = image.load_img(f, target_size=(224,224))
        img1 = np.array(img1)
        img1 = img1.reshape((1,224,224,3))
        img1 = img1/255
        prediction = model.predict(img1)
        pred = np.argmax(prediction)
        disease = SKIN_CLASSES[pred]
        accuracy = prediction[0][pred]
        K.clear_session()
    return render_template('uploaded.html', title='Success', predictions=disease, acc=accuracy*100, img_file=f.filename)

𝗕𝗘𝗥𝗕𝗔𝗡𝗗𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗟𝗘𝗟𝗔𝗞𝗜

Any help appreciated here!

items.title: Improved Error Messaging when API rate limit exceeded
items.body:
I also hit this due to API limits. I think they should at least improve the error messaging here to make this clearer. 

"JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)" (or anything in the callback trace) is not descriptive of the issue. It should be "LimitError: API Limit of <rate_limit> hit" or something.

_Originally posted by @skanalytic in https://github.com/ssut/py-googletrans/issues/144#issuecomment-614839998_

items.title: translate 결과에서 순위가 낮은 번역결과를 제시합니다.
items.body:
예를 들어, "기스 스크레치 없음 잔상 없음 모든 기능 이상 없이 작동 깨" 를 번역하면
결과1 : No scratch, no afterimage, no malfunction
결과2 : No scratch scratched afterimage no longer work without breaking any functionality
중에서, 결과2만을 반환하도록 함수가 작동합니다.

따라서, 모듈의 소스파일인 client.py 에서
googletrans.Translator()._translate 함수에서 다음 부분을

<original codes>
params = utils.build_params(query=text, src=src, dest=dest, token=token)
url = urls.TRANSLATE.format(host=self._pick_service_url())

<modified codes>
params = utils.build_params(query=text, src=src, dest=dest, token=token)
params['client'] = 'webapp'
url = urls.TRANSLATE.format(host=self._pick_service_url())

로 수정하면 정상작동합니다.

items.title: raise JSONDecodeError
items.body:
Hi, my code is just simply as follows:

import googletrans
from googletrans import Translator
translator = Translator()
translator.translate('bonjour')

I would like to test the package and the text is so short within the limit. But it raise error:
raise JSONDecodeError("Expecting value", s, err.value) from None

and the error message is
JSONDecodeError: Expecting value

Can anybody help me? It is really urgent and I don't know how to deal with it since the text is so short.
Thanks a lot!

items.title: Using bulk requests causes google to block you
items.body:
Not sure how many times it takes to trigger, maybe around 40 or 50 translations. The phrases must be different or it will not cause the block probably because the results were cached. ``` import googletrans translator = googletrans.Translator() translator.translate(['foo', 'bar']) ``` Result: About this page

Our systems have detected unusual traffic from your computer network. This page checks to see if it's really you sending the requests, and not a robot. Why did this happen?

This page appears when Google automatically detects requests coming from your computer network which appear to be in violation of the Terms of Service. The block will expire shortly after those requests stop. In the meantime, solving the above CAPTCHA will let you continue to use our services.

This traffic may have been sent by malicious software, a browser plug-in, or a script that sends automated requests. If you share your network connection, ask your administrator for help — a different computer using the same IP address may be responsible. Learn more

Sometimes you may be asked to solve the CAPTCHA if you are using advanced terms that robots are known to use, or sending requests very quickly.
